This work introduces a novel global meshing strategy for image geolocation inferencing, overcoming data limitations in training models and incorporating additional information to improve performance. Delaunay triangles are shown to be effective for geolocation in low volume scenarios compared to state-of-the-art models using quad trees and more training data. The novel global meshing strategy using Delaunay triangles improves geolocation accuracy in low volume scenarios compared to quad trees and more training data.
